alert.note: Alert for Charles City; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; James City; Middlesex; New Kent; Prince George; Surry (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 3:33PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of west central Middlesex, southeastern King and Queen, Charles City, northeastern Prince George, New Kent, southeastern King William, northwestern James City and northwestern Surry Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 332 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Talleysville to near Hopewell. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... New Kent, Charles City, West Point, Claremont, Talleysville, Roxbury, Adkins Store, Rustic, Ruthville, Providence Forge, Holdcroft, Barhamsville, Little Plymouth, Shacklefords, Eltham, Chickahominy Shore, Wayside, Mountcastle, Cohoke and Lanexa. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central, eastern, south central, southeastern and east central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; Eastern King William; Eastern King and Queen; James City; Middlesex; New Kent; Prince George; Surry
